titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität records
Notgemeinschaft fur eine freie Universitat records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-22T08:21-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Scanned the inventory and box list and attached PDF versions of those documents to the OAC record as guides to the collection. Wrote help text that appears at the beginning of PDFs and in Scope and Contents note (Sally DeBauche).

did.unittitle: Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität records

physdesc.extent: 1495 manuscript boxes, 40 oversize boxes, 73 card file boxes, 3 cubic foot boxes

did.abstract: Clippings, serial issues, pamphlets, flyers, leaflets, reports, resolutions, press releases, correspondence, financial records, card files, and printed matter, relating to radicalism in the faculty and student body of the Freie Universität Berlin and other German educational institutions. Includes a large quantity of material collected by the organization.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität (Berlin, Germany)

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 1187-1239, 1241, 1252-1409, 1453-1454, 1492, 1500, and 1548-1611 closed until 2021 March 5. Remainder of collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1991.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: German organization to promote academic freedom at the Freie Universität Berlin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The inventory of the Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität records was created by the organization itself for its own internal use, and that document has been attached here as a guide to the collection. The inventory and corresponding box list were generated from a database kept by the Notgemeinschaft and have been attached to the finding aid as PDFs to serve as supplemental guides to the collection. The original physical inventory and box list are located in boxes 1410-1411 of the collection itself, and the PDF versions were created by scanning and OCRing those documents. Because the inventory was generated from a database, the information contained within is structured by numbered fields. Below is a key to these fields:

#00: Line break #20: Highest hierarchical level (series level or subseries level) #21: The second highest hierarchical level (sub-series level or item level) #22: The third highest hierarchical level (sub-sub-series level or item level) #23: The fourth highest hierarchical level (sub-sub-sub-series level or item level) #24: The fifth highest hierarchical level (item level) #86: "Mappennummer (n) laut Standortverzeichnis," which translates to "folder numbers run in standard order." This likely refers to the following #90 field, which gives the individual item/file number. #90: Item/file number
To find materials in the Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität records, first review the inventory, then consult the box list to determine the box location of the files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: The Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität records were arranged by the organization, and the original order has been maintained here. The collection consists of 14 sections: Foreign; Federal Republic of Germany; Federal States; Higher Education; Berlin; Free University of Berlin; Education in Berlin; Berlin, Other; Notgemeinschaft für eine freie Universität, Bund Freiheit der Wissenschaft and related organizations; Persons; Concepts; Periodicals; Continuously Numbered Files; Preliminary Files; Files of the Notgemeinschaft in Leitz or Standard Order.
